intro: Adhatoda rostellaria var. humilis, commonly known as the lesser adhatoda, is a herbaceous plant native to tropical regions of Asia. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae and is characterized by its opposite, ovate leaves with serrated edges. The plant produces small, white or pale yellow flowers arranged in clusters, which bloom during the rainy season. It is often found in moist, shaded environments such as forests and stream banks. Its leaves are used in traditional medicine for their purported respiratory and anti-inflammatory properties.
